subject: Business
title: Confirmation Bias: Seeing What You Expect
description: A quick win: understand Confirmation Bias: Seeing What You Expect.

hook.text: You think your product is great. So you read every positive review and skip the negative ones.

buildup.text: Confirmation bias means we seek evidence that supports what we already believe.

discovery.text: Peter Wason's card experiment showed people test rules by looking for confirming cases, not disconfirming ones.

twist.text: Scientists are supposed to be objective. Studies show they interpret ambiguous data to match their hypothesis.

climax.text: The antidote: actively seek reasons you might be wrong. Ask 'What would change my mind?'

punchline.text: We don't see the world as it is. We see it as we are.

quiz.question: What is confirmation bias?
options: Seeking evidence that supports existing beliefs
Being overly confident in your abilities
